name: Density Coordinated Ramp Control: Field Implementation
location: W 50th St Bridge luminary, Approximately, W 48th St sound wall (Backup), Morningside Rd sound wall (Backup), W 41st St pedestrian bridge or sound wall, Park Center Blvd luminary, W 36th St Bridge overpass, Cedar Lake Trail Bridge overpass, Approximately between TH-7 and Co Rd 5 (Minnetonka Blvd), Approximately at the TH-100 NB exit to Co Rd 5 (Minnetonka Blvd)
purpose: This project evaluated the UMD KAdaptive ramp metering algorithm on Twin Cities freeways, ultimately replacing the existing Stratified Zone algorithm system-wide, while plans to test the UMN Density algorithm were deferred due to technical and scheduling issues.
author: John Hourdos, Nikolas Geroliminis, Stephen Zitzow, and Ypatia Stefania Limniati
image_description: Image of a ramp meter: a small traffic light (red) installed on a highway on-ramp

cameras.name: Hwy 100 and Cedar Lake Trail Bridge (Greenway)
